fact_check_explanation_title: Do 40% of new teachers in England leave within a year?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The answer depends on which data you look at and even then it's limited. Without better data, it's impossible to know for sure.

fact_check_explanation_title: How many deaths occur in police custody?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Home Secretary Theresa May has announced an independent review of deaths in police custody. We take a look at the latest figures.

fact_check_explanation_title: The "too old to adopt their granddaughter" myth
fact_check_explanation_summary: A widely reported story about a judge refusing to allow a child to live with her grandparents, because they were too old, is proved wrong by the judgment.

fact_check_explanation_title: Tax credits: how much has spending increased in 16 years?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Chancellor of the Exchequer claims tax credit spending has increased thirty-fold in 16 years. But not all the figures are comparable over time.

fact_check_explanation_title: Have the government's tuition fee reforms worked?
fact_check_explanation_summary: We look at how the Higher Education reforms have worked out for students, graduates, universities and the public.

fact_check_explanation_title: Paying off the debt, one law at a time
fact_check_explanation_summary: Rules like the "budget surplus law" can always be repealed by a future government, and broken without any particular legal consequences in any event.

fact_check_explanation_title: Is the UK's deficit one of the highest in the developed world?
fact_check_explanation_summary: Latest figures forecast the UK to have a budget deficit of 3.7% of its GDP by 2015/16, down from 4.9% in 2014/15, one of the higher deficits in the developed …

fact_check_explanation_title: Ask Full Fact: Employment, unemployment and jobseekers
fact_check_explanation_summary: This article has been updated. Over on our Facebook page, some readers had questions about our roundup of employment figures. Where does the unemployment figure of 1.85 million come from, …

fact_check_explanation_title: Early help for children—uncertain definition leads to uncertain estimates
fact_check_explanation_summary: The government says it's increased funding for early help for vulnerable children, but charities say funding is down. It depends on what services you count.

fact_check_explanation_title: Prisoners absconding: an open and shut case?
fact_check_explanation_summary: This week's Prime Minister's Questions heard many claims about prisoners on the run. We establish the facts.

fact_check_explanation_title: PMQs follow up: unemployment and benefits
fact_check_explanation_summary: Prime Minister's Questions went in heavy on unemployment and out of work benefits. We've rounded up and checked the claims.

fact_check_explanation_title: 7-day NHS: no source yet for claims that 6,000 deaths a year could be avoided
fact_check_explanation_summary: Health Secretary Jeremy Hunt has said 6,000 people a year die because hospitals don't offer a 7-day service, but the evidence for this hasn't been published
